author: Omar Rashid
title: EC seeks report on Sakshi Maharaj comments on Muslim population
text:
January 07, 2017 16:09   16:09 IST more-in 
No stranger to provocative rhetoric, BJP MP from Unnao, Sachidanand Hari Sakshi alias Sakshi Maharaj has landed in a fresh controversy with his alleged communal remarks that Muslims are responsible for the population-related problems arising in the country. 
The Uttar Pradesh Election Commission took notice and on Saturday summoned a report from the administration in Meerut where the controversial leader made the remarks on Friday. 
The EC a few days ago enforced the Model Code of Conduct for the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections and remarks against a particular community could amount to violation. 
Speaking at a religious function on Friday, Mr. Maharaj, without taking any names, said a particular community, and not the Hindus, was responsible for the population problems in the country. 
“Population is giving rise to problems in the country. The Hindus are not responsible for that. Responsible are those who talk of four wives ad forty children,” the MP said. “We say four wives and forty children won’t do, won’t do, won’t do...it is not the time for four wives ad forty children. Women are not machines. Women should be respected, be they Hindu or Muslim,” he said. 
ADM administration, Meerut, Dinesh Chandra told The Hindu : “Yes, it (EC) has sought a report from the ADM City and SP city (Meerut). We will soon inform you of the action we are taking.” 
Sakshi Maharaj later sought to clarify his remarks claiming he did not target any community. “I have been misquoted and am ready to face Election Commission," he told a news channel. He could not be reached for further comment.
